definition-item.definition-title: HANDLING OF COINS OR VALUABLE PAPERS, e.g. TESTING, SORTING BY DENOMINATIONS, COUNTING, DISPENSING, CHANGING OR DEPOSITING

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
This subclass covers handling of "coins" or "paper currency" insofar as they carry distinctive value features representative of money or the like.

list-item.paragraph-text: "coins" also covers tokens of similar nature;
"paper currency or similar valuable papers" covers banknotes, bills, cheques, vouchers, securities, bonds or the like.

section-body.paragraph-text: Handling of articles in general is found in B65G and handling of sheet material in general is found in B65H.
Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Handling of sheet material in generalCoins as such
Counting of objects in general, i.e. without discriminating of denominations

section-body.paragraph-text: The IPC group G07D13/00 is not used in the internal ECLA classification scheme. Subject matter covered in IPC by this groups is classified in the ECLA subgroups under main group G07D11/00.
In this place, the following terms or expressions are used with the meaning indicated:

list-item.paragraph-text: "coins" also covers tokens of similar nature;
"paper currency or similar valuable papers" covers banknotes, bills, cheques, vouchers, securities, bonds or the like.

definition-item.definition-title: Coin dispensers (devices delivering paper currency G07D11/00)

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Dispensing coins or coin rolls from ordered arrangements thereof
Feeding of articles from stacks in general is to be found in B65G59/00
This place does not cover:
Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:
An additional class is given for aspects covered by G07D1/02 and subgroups

definition-item.definition-title: giving change {(coin-actuated mechanisms in general G07F)}

section-body.paragraph-text: Algorithms for giving change, for example which coins to dispense preferentially, are to be found in G07F5/24.
Coin-actuated mechanisms in general are to be found in G07F
This place does not cover:

table-column.paragraph-text: Algorithms for giving change; vending; return of a bulk of coins

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:
An additional class is given for aspects covered by G07D1/00.
There may be some overlap with G07F5/24

definition-item.definition-title: dispensing change equal to a sum deposited

section-body.paragraph-text: Algorithms for giving change, for example which coins to dispense preferentially, are to be found in G07F5/24
This place does not cover:

table-column.paragraph-text: Algorithms for giving change; vending; return of a bulk of coins

section-body.paragraph-text: An additional class is given for aspects covered by G07D1/00.
There may be some overlap with G07F5/24

definition-item.definition-title: dispensing the difference between a sum paid and a sum charged

section-body.paragraph-text: Algorithms for giving change, for example which coins to dispense preferentially, are to be found in G07F5/24
This place does not cover:

table-column.paragraph-text: Algorithms for giving change; vending; return of a bulk of coins

section-body.paragraph-text: There may be some overlap with G07F5/24

definition-item.definition-title: hand actuated

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
The devices classified here are typically carried by vehicles or persons involved in public transport
Cash registers or tills are to be found in G07G
This place does not cover:

table-column.paragraph-text: Algorithms for giving change; vending; return of a bulk of coins; cash registers or tills

definition-item.definition-title: Sorting a mixed bulk of coins into denominations

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:

Sorting of coins either by apertures which remove restraint keeping them on a path (G07D3/02 - G07D3/08) or in a space (G07D3/10), by deflectors which divert them from a path (G07D3/12) or by means of actuators responding to sensors (G07D3/14).
Sorting items in general is to be found in B07C. Sorting bulk material in general is to be found in B07B.
Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:
There may be some overlap with G07D5/00

definition-item.definition-title: Sorting coins by means of graded apertures

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Graded apertures sort coins by allowing or blocking their passage according to their dimensions, e.g. thickness, diameter
Sorting items in general is to be found in B07C.
This place does not cover:
There may be some overlap with G07D5/00

definition-item.definition-title: arranged on an inclined rail

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Single coins are sorted by a series of apertures.
Sorting items in general is to be found in B07C.
This place does not cover:
There may be some overlap with G07D5/00

definition-item.definition-title: arranged along a circular path

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Single coins are sorted by a series of apertures.
Sorting items in general is to be found in B07C.
This place does not cover:
There may be some overlap with G07D5/00

definition-item.definition-title: arranged on a helix

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Single coins are sorted by a series of apertures.
Sorting items in general is to be found in B07C.
This place does not cover:
There may be some overlap with G07D5/00

definition-item.definition-title: provided by sieves arranged in series

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Coins in bulk are sorted by a series of groups of apertures.
Sorting material in bulk in general is to be found in B07B.
This place does not cover:

definition-item.definition-title: Sorting coins by means of stepped deflectors

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Stepped deflectors sort coins by allowing their passage or diverting them to a branch path according to their dimensions, e.g. thickness, diameter.
Sorting items in general is to be found in B07C.
This place does not cover:
There may be some overlap with G07D5/00

definition-item.definition-title: {arranged on inclined paths}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Single coins are sorted by a series of deflectors.
Sorting items in general is to be found in B07C.
This place does not cover:
There may be some overlap with G07D5/00

definition-item.definition-title: {the coins being deflected off rails}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Single coins are sorted by a series of deflectors.
Sorting items in general is to be found in B07C.
This place does not cover:
There may be some overlap with G07D5/00

definition-item.definition-title: {by moving deflectors}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Single coins are sorted by a series of deflectors.
Sorting items in general is to be found in B07C.
This place does not cover:
There may be some overlap with G07D5/00

definition-item.definition-title: {the coins being diverted by ramps in channels}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Single coins are sorted by a series of deflectors.
Sorting items in general is to be found in B07C.
This place does not cover:
There may be some overlap with G07D5/00

definition-item.definition-title: {Rotary devices}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Single coins are sorted by a series of deflectors.
Sorting items in general is to be found in B07C.
This place does not cover:
There may be some overlap with G07D5/00

definition-item.definition-title: Apparatus driven under control of coin-sensing elements

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Single coins are sorted according to signals from sensors, for instance in combination with determination of timing or coin position.
Sorting items in general is to be found in B07C.
This place does not cover:
There may be some overlap with G07D5/00.
Some documents may also be classified in G07D5/00

definition-item.definition-title: in combination with coin-counting

section-body.paragraph-text: This group is used only when counting is of special significance, and then even when sorting does not occur, the special significance residing in the method and/or means of counting or in an influence on a process such as dispensing or storing coins.

definition-item.definition-title: Testing specially adapted to determine the identity or genuineness of coins, e.g. for segregating coins which are unacceptable or alien to a currency

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:

Testing coins for genuineness irrespective of the context: the testing may occur in banking machines, vending machines, cash registers etc. Vibration and acoustic characteristics of coins are classified in this head group.
Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Details other than those peculiar to special kinds or types of apparatus
Registering the receipt of cash, valuables, or tokens

section-body.paragraph-text: In groups G07D5/02-G07D5/10, in the absence of an indication to the contrary, classification is made in the last appropriate place

definition-item.definition-title: {Testing the surface pattern, e.g. relief}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
The expression "surface pattern" refers to impressions on the flat faces of coins and to rims extending in the direction of the axis of a coin.
Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

definition-item.definition-title: Testing the dimensions, e.g. thickness, diameter; Testing the deformation

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Only testing of dimensions.
Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Testing deformation in the sense of vibrations, hardness (e.g. plastic properties) or elastic properties

definition-item.definition-title: Testing the hardness or elasticity

section-body.paragraph-text: Vibration and acoustic properties are classified in the main group G07D5/00.

definition-item.definition-title: Testing the rim, e.g. the milling of the rim

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Feature on the periphery of coins are covered.
Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

definition-item.definition-title: Testing specially adapted to determine the identity or genuineness of valuable papers or for segregating those which are unacceptable, e.g. banknotes that are alien to a currency

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:

Testing of paper currency in banking machines, vending machines, or cash registers, wherein both the identity, e.g. currency or denomination, and the genuineness, i.e. validity or authenticity, are assessed. Inspection, identification or validation processes can be different in degree of strictness, for example, basic features, e.g. size or colour, may be used to identify the denomination or identity, whereas security features, e.g. holograms, patterns, (digital) watermarks or metallic strips, may be used to verify the authenticity.
Assessment of fitness for recirculation.
Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Devices accepting coins or paper currency, e.g. depositing machines
Printed matter of special format or style not otherwise provided for
Arrangements for verifying the correctness of markings on a record carrier
Coin-freed apparatus for controlling dispensing of fluids, semiliquids or granular material from reservoirs
Complete banking systems; Coded card-freed arrangements adapted for dispensing or receiving monies or the like and posting such transactions to existing accounts, e.g. automatic teller machines
Registering the receipt of cash, valuables or tokens

section-body.paragraph-text: The main group comprises two sections. The first section G07D7/003 – G07D7/01 covers the features of valuable papers rather than the methods and means of testing. The second section, G07D7/02 – G07D7/20 relates to methods and means of testing.
Classification is made in both ranges as identified above, whenever appropriate.

definition-item.definition-title: {using holograms}

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Printed matter of special format or style not otherwise provided for

definition-item.definition-title: {using watermarks}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Watermarks visible to the naked eye, e.g. printed on paper with visible ink
Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Printed matter of special format or style not otherwise provided for

definition-item.definition-title: using digital security elements, e.g. information coded on a magnetic thread or strip

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Digital security elements, where the information is coded on a magnetic thread or strip.
While G07D7/00 covers testing of paper currency, the printing of paper currency is covered by B42D.

definition-item.definition-title: using barcodes

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Printed matter of special format or style not otherwise provided for

definition-item.definition-title: using checkcodes, e.g. coded numbers derived from serial number and denomination

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Printed matter of special format or style not otherwise provided for

definition-item.definition-title: Testing security markings invisible to the naked eye, e.g. verifying thickened lines or unobtrusive markings or alterations

section-body.paragraph-text: This subgroup and its sub groups are related to subgroups G07D7/20 - G07D7/207.
Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:
Classification is made additionally in the range G07D7/20-G07D7/207 whenever appropriate.

definition-item.definition-title: {involving markings added to a pattern, e.g. interstitial points}

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:
Classification is made additionally in the range G07D7/20-G07D7/207 whenever appropriate.

definition-item.definition-title: {involving markings the properties of which are altered from original properties}

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:
Classification is made additionally in the range G07D7/20-G07D7/207 whenever appropriate.

definition-item.definition-title: {involving markings displaced slightly from original positions within a pattern}

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:
Classification is made additionally in the range G07D7/20-G07D7/207 whenever appropriate.

definition-item.definition-title: {involving markings which are altered in dimension, e.g. thickened lines}

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:
Classification is made additionally in the range G07D7/20-G07D7/207 whenever appropriate.

definition-item.definition-title: Testing electronic circuits therein

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:
Classification is made additionally in the range G07D7/20-G07D7/207 whenever appropriate.
Groups G07D7/16-G07D7/20 take precedence over groups G07D7/02-G07D7/14.

definition-item.definition-title: Testing electrical properties of the materials thereof (G07D7/01 takes precedence)

section-body.paragraph-text: This place does not cover:
Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

Printed matter of special format or style not otherwise provided for

section-body.paragraph-text: Groups G07D7/16-G07D7/20 take precedence over groups G07D7/02-G07D7/14.

definition-item.definition-title: Measuring conductivity by direct contact

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

section-body.paragraph-text: This place does not cover:

section-body.paragraph-text: Groups G07D7/16-G07D7/20 take precedence over groups G07D7/02-G07D7/14.

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Testing specially adapted to determine the identity or genuineness of paper currency or similar valuable papers, e.g. for segregating those which are unacceptable or alien to a currency using digital security elements

definition-item.definition-title: Visible light, infrared or ultraviolet radiation

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

definition-item.definition-title: Testing spectral properties

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

definition-item.definition-title: Viewing devices

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
These viewing devices present a physical view of the tested object for visual checking.

definition-item.definition-title: Testing mechanical properties or condition, e.g. wear or tear (G07D7/16 takes precedence)

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
This group is used for general wear and tear (fitness).
This place does not cover:

table-column.paragraph-text: Testing the dimensions to determine the identity or genuineness of paper currency or similar valuable papers

definition-item.definition-title: Detecting folds or doubles

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:
Only subject matter relating to testing of valuable papers should be classified in this group.

definition-item.definition-title: Detecting defacement or contamination, e.g. dirt

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:
Groups G07D7/16-G07D7/20 take precedence over groups G07D7/02-G07D7/14.

definition-item.definition-title: Testing patterns thereon (G07D7/004, G07D7/005 take precedence)

section-body.paragraph-text: This place does not cover:

table-column.paragraph-text: Testing specially adapted to determine the identity or genuineness of paper currency or similar valuable papers, e.g. for segregating those which are unacceptable or alien to a currency using digital security elements
Testing security markings invisible to the naked eye, e.g. verifying thickened lines or unobtrusive markings or alterations

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Image or video recognition or understanding

definition-item.definition-title: using pattern matching

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Pattern matching in general; template/reference matching.
Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Pattern matching criteria, e.g. proximity measures

definition-item.definition-title: {Matching spectral properties}

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

definition-item.definition-title: Matching patterns that are created by the interaction of two or more layers, e.g. moiré patterns

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Printed matter of special format or style not otherwise provided for

definition-item.definition-title: Counting coins (in combination with coin-sorting G07D3/16); Handling of coins not provided for in the other groups of this subclass

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
This head group covers machines which accept deposits of coins and dispense coins in the manner that ATMs accept and dispense paper money. Some of these machines handle paper money as well as coins.

Handling of objects in general: B65G. Machines which accept and dispense paper money are found in G07D11/00, the transactional and user-interface aspects of such machines (ATMs) being found in G06Q20/00 and G07F19/00.
This place does not cover:

table-column.paragraph-text: Counting coins in combination with coin-sorting
Handling paper money; transactional aspects; user-interface aspects.

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:
Machines handling paper money as well as coins should be classified also in G07D11/00.

definition-item.definition-title: {Coin holding devices}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Includes coin trays and other holders for stacked coins, many of which include means which facilitate counting of coins.
Containers in general: B65D. Purses, etc.: A45C1/00.
Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

definition-item.definition-title: {Coin packages}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Rigid packages for a single stack of coins.

definition-item.definition-title: {Coin wrappers}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Flexible wrappers for a single stack of coins.
Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

definition-item.definition-title: {Feeding coins from bulk}

section-body.paragraph-text: Feeding articles in general: B65G47/00.
This place does not cover:

table-column.paragraph-text: Feeding coins from ordered arrangements thereof; feeding articles in general.

definition-item.definition-title: Change trays

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
These are for holding coins in unordered arrangements being present to persons as change.

definition-item.definition-title: Hand- or motor-driven devices for counting coins {(counting mechanisms in general G06M)}

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

definition-item.definition-title: Devices for stacking or otherwise arranging coins on a support, e.g. apertured plate for use in counting coins

section-body.paragraph-text: Stacking objects in general: B65G57/00.
Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

definition-item.definition-title: {Devices for wrapping coins}

section-body.paragraph-text: Wrapping objects in general: B65B.
Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

definition-item.definition-title: Devices accepting coins; Devices accepting, dispensing, sorting or counting valuable papers

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
This group and its subgroups cover machines which accept deposits of paper money and dispense paper money. Some of these machines handle coins as well as paper money.
This group covers constructional and functional aspects of devices handling paper currency, e.g. automatic teller machines [ATMs].
Other aspects of ATMs, e.g. posting transactions to existing accounts or aspects related to the interaction with the users, are covered by group G07F19/20.
Payment architectures, schemes or protocols are covered by group G06Q20/00.
Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Handling of sheet material in general
Apparatus freed or actuated by coins or the like
Apparatus freed or actuated by paper currency
Transactional aspects and user-interface aspects of ATMs

section-body.paragraph-text: Machines handling coins as well as paper money should be classified also in G07D9/00.

definition-item.definition-title: {Banknote changing devices}

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

definition-item.definition-title: {Depositing devices}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
These devices are mostly one-way devices: nothing is dispensed.
Dispensing of paper money is elsewhere in G07D11/00.
Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

definition-item.definition-title: {Drop boxes}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
These are usually placed near a cash register and mostly accept banknotes singly.

definition-item.definition-title: {Accepting paper currency or other valuables in containers, e.g. in code-marked envelopes}

section-body.paragraph-text: Tracking and tracing of containers is to be found in G07D11/30. Transactional aspects are to be found in G06Q20/00, G07F19/00.
Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

definition-item.definition-title: Handling of coins or of valuable papers, characterised by a combination of mechanisms not covered by a single one of groups G07D1/00 - G07D11/00

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
This group is not used.
Use instead G07D11/00 and subgroups
